title: Boundary behavior - f and v vs string thickness

content.question:
Two uniform strings made of the same material have different thicknesses. The strings are attached together, as shown in the figure. A student shakes the thin string from side to side several times to create a periodic wave with frequency <math alttext="f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> that travels through the string with speed <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The wave is transmitted into the thicker string, where it has frequency <math alttext="f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and speed <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?
FrequencySpeedA<math alttext="f sub 1 is greater than f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math><math alttext="v sub 1 is greater than v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>B<math alttext="f sub 1 is greater than f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math><math alttext="v sub 1 is less than v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>C<math alttext="f sub 1 equals f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math><math alttext="v sub 1 is greater than v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>D<math alttext="f sub 1 equals f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math><math alttext="v sub 1 is less than v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

topic.text: 14.3: Boundary Behavior of Waves and Polarization

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
